titleStmt.title: W.A. Stewart v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: W.A. Stewart v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory
In the matter of the application of W.A. Stewart for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon Mark Allyn As- sociate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of the Second Judicial District
The petition of W.A. Stewart respectfully shows.

That your petitioner W.A. Stewart is un- lawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by Wm Billings Sheriff of Thurston County, Wash Ty at Olympia in the county of Thurston in the Territory of Wash- ington.

That the said imprisonment, detention, con- finement and restraint are illegal; and that the illegality thereof consists in this, towit; That on the 28th day of Sept A.D. 1888 the following complaint was made before W.T. Keady a committing magistrate and Justice of the Peace in Olympia Precinct, Thurston County Wsh Ty.
In the Justice Court of Thurston County Wsh Territory of Washington vs Stewart
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss

Edward Arnold being first duly sworn says: That he accuses Stewart whose first name is to affiant of the crime of an assault with a deadly weapon with an intent to inflict upon the person of this a bodily injury where no considerable provication appeared, committed at the County of Thurston in Washington Territory on Sept 28th 1888, by then and there assaulting affiant with are from between three and five feet in length and about one inch in circumference, contrary to of the statute; Wherefore affiant prays that Stewart may be arrested and punished.
E.D. Arnold Subscribed and sworn to before me this 28th day of Sept 1888 W.T. Keady Justice of the Peace
Witnesses to H. Furtan and K.J. Williams Filed Sept 28th 1888
W.T. Keady J.P. and that upon mid complaint a warrant of arrest was issued in words and following
"Criminal Warrant"
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss

To the Sheriff or any Constable of said County, Whereas Edward Arnold has this day complained in writing, under oath, to the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, that on the 28th day of September 1888 at Chambers Prairie in said County one Stewart first name to affiant, did commit the offense of assault and battery upon the person of this affiant. Therefore, in the name of the United States, you are commanded forthwith to apprehend the said Stewart and bring him before me, to be dealth with according to law. Given under my hand this 28th day of September 1888.
W.T. Keady Justice of the Peace

Which said warrant was duly served and the said Stewart brought into Court on the said 28th day of Sept A.D. 1888. That upon motion of your petitioners attorney, the examination was adjourned until ten o'clock on the 29th day of Sept 1888, at which time your petitioner appeared and the Court proceeded with the examination. That after hearing the testimony the Court found as follows: First: on motion of Pros atty Robinson the Court held the charge as one assault and battery, and the court held the defendant guilty of the same. Wherefore it is considered and adjudged by the Court by reason of the law and the evidence, that the defendant W.A. Stewart is guilty of the charge of making one assault and battery upon the person of Ed Arnold and that he shall pay a fine of ten dollars together with the costs hererin to be taxed and that in default he be committed to the jail of Thurston County, there to remain until discharged by due course of law.

That after the examination of said witnesses as to the truth of the charge con- tained in said complaint, and before sentence was proved, your petitioner demanded a jury trial, which the Court refused and in direct volition of law and within any trial sanctioned your petition as known before stated and issued the following commitment
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss

In the Justice Court before W.T. Keady J.P. To the Sheriff and the Keeper of the County jail of said County; Whereas, at a Committing Magistrate Court, led at my office in said city, for the trial of W.A. Stewart for the offense stated, the said W.A. Stewart was convicted of having on the 18th day of September 1888 in said county, committed an assault and battery upon the person of one Edward Arnold - and upon conviction the said Court did adjudge and determine that the said W.A. Stewart pay a fine of $10.00 and costs of suit, herein total at $30.10 and in default stated committed to the County jail until such fine and costs are paid. Therefore, you, the said Sheriff are commanded in the name of the United States,
